title: Occurs when you do the following "npm install -g truffle"

Hey @ukyo717, for now Truffle is only compatible with npm < 7. It looks like you are using version 8, could you try downgrading your npm and installing again?
You can do this by entering
```
npm install -g npm@6
```

Thanks to reply.
It's my answer.
@eggplantzzz what are the steps needed in order to support npm 8? Is there an issue for that?

I have similar issue

OS: windows 10 pro
node: 16.3.2
npm: used to be version 8 and them downgraded to 6.14.16 based on the comments

tried with yarn too

I found a solution that worked for me:

The node-gyp docs state that "node-gyp requires that you have installed a compatible version of Python, one of: v3.6, v3.7, v3.8, or v3.9.", and I had 3.10.2, as I notice you do. 

- Run `npm install --global windows-build-tools`. Since this installs some 2.7 Python version, i uninstalled it to do the next step.
- Install Python 3.9 (https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3910/)
- Install node-gyp: `npm install -g node-gyp`
- Clear npm cache: `npm cache clear --force`
- Finally hit `npm i -g truffle`

Hope it helps!

By the way, Im running Windows 10, with Node 16.14.0 and npm 8.3.1

> Hey @ukyo717, for now Truffle is only compatible with npm < 7. It looks like you are using version 8, could you try downgrading your npm and installing again? You can do this by entering
> 
> ```
> npm install -g npm@6
> ```

this saved my life, spent hours trying to figure out what was wrong. Had the same issue on centos fedora 35 machine with npm v 8.5.5. thanks Guys :)

> I found a solution that worked for me:
> 
> The node-gyp docs state that "node-gyp requires that you have installed a compatible version of Python, one of: v3.6, v3.7, v3.8, or v3.9.", and I had 3.10.2, as I notice you do.
> 
>     * Run `npm install --global windows-build-tools`. Since this installs some 2.7 Python version, i uninstalled it to do the next step.
> 
>     * Install Python 3.9 (https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3910/)
> 
>     * Install node-gyp: `npm install -g node-gyp`
>

> 
>     * Finally hit `npm i -g truffle`
>

> Hope it helps!

> By the way, Im running Windows 10, with Node 16.14.0 and npm 8.3.1

I have pythin 3.9 installed and had the same error. But on linux instead.
I confirm that `npm install -g npm@6` solves the problem
npm install -g npm@6 worked for me too but there should be a way we be able to use it with the latest npm also.

Thank you all guys, I was feeling lost about this issue and after a couple of tries everything worked just fine.
Installed npm@6 and downgraded python to 3.9.1.

Sweet!!

Try few hours to find solutions and it's working finally! Thank you!

problem: wrong version of npm
solution: npm install -g npm@6
